Phyllis Frankl Professor Emeritus Computer Science and Engineering Connect Students with questions about CS courses, degree requirements, permission to take courses, etc, should contact their academic advisors or email: cseadvisement@nyu.edu Research Interests Software analysis and testing Education Brandeis University Bachelor of Arts, Mathematics and Physics Columbia University Master of Arts, Mathematics Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences, New York University Master of Science, Computer Science Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences, New York University 1987 Doctor of Philosophy, Computer Science Publications Selected Journal Articles "Prevalence of confusing code in software projects: atoms of confusion in the wild," Dan Gopstein, Hongwei Henry Zhou, Phyllis Frankl, and Justin Cappos, MSR '18 Proceedings of the 15th International Conference on Mining Software Repositories, May 2018, pp. 281-91. "An AGENDA for testing relational database applications," David Chays, Yuetang Deng, Phyllis G. Frankl, Saikat Dan, Filippos I. Vokolos, and Elaine J. Weyuker, Software: Testing, Verification and Reliability, Volume 14 Issue 1, March 2004, pp. 17-44. "The ASTOOT approach to testing object-oriented programs," Roong-Ko Doong and Phyllis Frankl, ACM Transactions on Software Engineering and Methodology, Volume 3 Issue 2, April 1994, pp. 101-30. Weiss, IEEE Transactions on Software Engineering, Volume 19 Number 8, August 1993, pp. 774-87.
